comments:
Create a project that has org.eclipse.swt as a dependent project and open
Empty.java.  The following NPE occurs:

Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException)
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.jface.JFaceColorProxyRegistration.getRGBBeanProxy(JFaceColorProxyRegistration.java:82)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.jface.JFaceColorProxyRegistration.initialize(JFaceColorProxyRegistration.java:56)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.jface.JFaceConfigurationContributor.contributeToRegistry(JFaceConfigurationContributor.java:27)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyLaunchSupport$3.run(ProxyLaunchSupport.java:450)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:1021)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:757)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyLaunchSupport.startImplementation(ProxyLaunchSupport.java:442)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyLaunchSupport.startImplementation(ProxyLaunchSupport.java:295)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyLaunchSupport.startImplementation(ProxyLaunchSupport.java:227)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorVMController$CreateRegistry.run(JavaVisualEditorVMController.java:164)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

This is kind of a special case since the JFace/SWT classes aren't in the
classpath but the JFaceConfigurationContributor gets fired up. 
I added a check to ensure the SWT RGB class is there before making calls to its
bean proxy.

Committed to HEAD (1.1) for M1.
